intro: Dissocarpus, commonly known as the false sandwort, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Montiaceae. These plants are typically small, herbaceous, and often grow in arid or semi-arid environments. They are characterized by their succulent leaves and small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or white. The genus includes several species, many of which are found in regions of Africa, Asia, and the Americas. Dissocarpus plants are adapted to survive in harsh conditions, often storing water in their thick leaves and stems.
